title: ISSS608
text: Welcome to my homepage. Let’s aim for A++

title: Hands-on Ex 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on Ex 1
text:
Creating data visualisation beyond default





Tableau Public













No.
Step
Action




1
Load excel file
Click to a file > choose excel file > Open.



2
Bin age group in 10s. Select down arrow > Create Group



3
Label bins and add selection to group



4
Separate the male and female population. Right click “Population” > Create > Calculated Field



5
Create a field “Male”.
Code: If [Sex] = “Males” THEN [Pop] END
Count the Males in the Population



6
Create a field “Females”.
Code: If [Sex] = “Males” THEN [Pop] END
Count the Females in the Population



7
Populate the Male and Female population in Columns by Age Group.
To create a pyramid, right click on Male>Edit Axis



8
a. Range > Fixed > End 24,000
To ensure Male and Female axis is synced.
b. Scale > Select Reversed



9
Show Top 9 Planning area.
Select down arrow key > Filter > Top > Top 9 > Pop Sum



10
Change colour of Female population.
Under SUM(Female) > Colour > Select Colour



11
Insert Avg Line per Planning Area



12
Publish on Tableau Public.
Sever > Tableau Public > Save to Tableau Public












We observed that for the overall average, there are more females than males. This is also persistent in most planning areas with the exception of Jurong West and Woodlands. This maybe because of the labour intensive job opportunities in that area which cause more males to move to that area.



We observed that in the following planning areas, there is a sharp dip in the population aged 40 - 49. The population for 50 then increases before it dips down again at 60.

Bukit Batok
Chua Chu Kang
Hougang
Tampines
Yishun
Woodlands (Males only)




For all top 9 planning areas, there are more females than males aged 89 and above. This is inline with research (https://www.prb.org/resources/around-the-globe-women-outlive-men/) that women have a longer life expectancy than men.



The planning areas Hougang and Yishun has the average population closest to the average line and thus would be an optimal area to do a population survey using these areas as statistical representation.
